sen.j: 柳本藩（やなぎもとはん）は、大和国式上郡・山辺郡・宇陀郡を領有した藩。
sen.e: Yanagimoto domain covered Shikijo, Yamabe and Uda counties of Yamato-no-kuni.

sen.cmt: Domain を大文字にしました。Yamato Province としました。

sen.j: 藩庁は柳本陣屋（現在の奈良県天理市柳本町黒塚古墳）。
sen.e: The seat of government was the Yanagimoto Jinya (present-day Kurozuka Tumulus, Yanagimoto-cho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture).

sen.e: Although the domain government was a jinya, the family status was equivalent to a castle-owning feudal lord.

sen.j: 織田信長の弟で、茶道として有名な織田長益（織田長益）は、慶長5年（1600年）の関ヶ原の戦いで東軍に与して戦功を挙げたことから、大和国と河内国の内に3万石の所領を与えられた。
sen.e: Nagamasu ODA, the younger brother of Nobunaga ODA and a famous master of tea ceremony, received domain worth 30,000 koku (rice yield) in Yamato-no-kuni and Kawachi-no-kuni provinces, after military success contributing to the victory of the East camp in the Battle of Sekigahara of 1600.

Nagamasu ODA, the younger brother of Nobunaga ODA and a famous master of tea ceremony, received domain worth 30,000 koku (an unit of assessed crop yields of the land [1 koku: about 180 liter], which was also used to express the size of the land) in Yamato Province and Kawachi Province, after military success contributing to the victory of the East camp in the Battle of Sekigahara of 1600.
sen.cmt: Yamato Province としました。石（koku) 補足を追加しました。

sen.j: その後は徳川家康に仕えず、豊臣秀頼の大叔父ということで秀頼の家臣となっていた。
sen.e: Later, he did not serve Ieyasu TOKUGAWA but, being a grand-uncle to Hideyori TOYOTOMI, chose to become his vassal.

sen.j: 大坂冬の陣では豊臣方として戦ったが、その裏では徳川方に内通したり、冬の陣における和睦交渉で裏工作を行なっている。
sen.e: Although he allied with the Toyotomi camp in the Winter Siege of Osaka, he engaged in covert activities, providing information to the Tokugawa side and engaging in reconciliatory talks during the siege.

sen.j: そして夏の陣直前に豊臣方から離れたため、戦後に罪には問われなかった。
sen.e: He did not suffer punitive action from the Tokugawa later in history because of his departure from the Toyotomi camp prior to the Summer Siege.

sen.j: しかし有楽斎は藩領3万石のうち、1万石を自分の隠居料とし、残りの2万石うち、1万石を四男の織田長政 (大名)に、同じく1万石を五男の織田尚長にそれぞれ分与した。
sen.e: On retirement, however, Yurakusai divided the domain, keeping 10,000 koku as retirement stipend and giving 10,000 koku to his 4th son Nagamasa ODA (a feudal lord) and 10,000 koku to his 5th son Naonaga ODA.

sen.j: このため、長政の系統は大和国芝村藩として、尚長の系統は柳本藩として存続することとなる。
sen.e: Hence, Nagamasa and his descendants held Shibamura Domain of Yamato-no-kuni and Naonaga's family held to Yanagimoto domain.

sen.j: 柳本藩は尚長の後、織田長種、織田秀一と続いたが、第4代藩主・織田秀親の代である宝永6年（1709年）2月、前将軍・徳川綱吉の法会が寛永寺で行なわれているときに、発狂した前田利昌 (大聖寺新田藩主)によって秀親が殺されてしまったのであった。
sen.e: Yanagimoto Domain continued after Naonaga, with his successors Nagatane and Hidekazu ODA, but faced a crisis with the 4th lord Hidechika ODA, when he was killed by the crazed lord of Daishoiji Nitta Domain Toshimasa MAEDA, during a Buddhist mass held in memorial of the late shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA at Kanei-ji Temple in February 1709.

sen.j: このため、柳本藩は改易の危機を迎えたが、藩の家老たちが機転をきかせて秀親は病死ということにして弟の織田成純を養嗣子として後を継がせ、改易の危機を脱したのである。
sen.e: The threat of collapse was averted by the Yanagimoto retainers who acted quickly to claim the passing of Hidechika due to illness and appointment of his brother Naritoshi ODA as adoptive heir.

The threat of collapse was averted by the Karo (chief retainers) of Yanagimoto Domain who acted quickly to claim the passing of Hidechika due to illness and by the appointment of his brother Naritoshi ODA as adoptive heir.

sen.j: 明治維新後は版籍奉還により藩知事となり、明治4年（1871年）の廃藩置県により柳本藩は廃藩となり、柳本県を経て奈良県に編入されたのである。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, Oda was designated governor of the domain with abolition of feudal domains and restoration of Imperial rule, and Yanagimoto domain was dissolved with establishment of the prefectural government system in 1871, established initially as Yanagimoto Prefecture and later amalgamated into Nara Prefecture.
